info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 1:22AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 122 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Miramar Parkway And University Drive, or over Miami Gardens, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Dania Beach, Cooper City, Sunny Isles Beach, Opa-Locka, West Park, Royal Palm Ranches, Estates Of Fort Lauderdale, Miramar Parkway And University Drive, Oak Point, Hard Rock Stadium and Golden Glades. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
